page.title: 14The Gravel Pits CSP
page.content: The gravel pits are situated to the east of the area they stretch between the river Colne and Grand Union Canal. Some pits are still worked but the ones on our area ceased production about 10 years ago.Remains of the old buildings can be seen and the site is used as a storage depot for sand and lime by a builder who owns most of the land.This does not disturb the wildlife which has colonized the waterfilled pits.These include moorhens,coots,herons & swans. There are also many varieties of wild- flowers;daisies,thistle,legumes as well as gorse,bramble,willow,hawthorn and elder.One of the lakes is owned by a fishing club and the other by a sailing club.
